intro: Karatas morreniana, commonly known as the Morren’s karatas, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
